article.class: post-7618 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-district category-libby-elementary-school category-libby-middle-high-school category-libby-public-school

div.div: District, Libby Elementary School, Libby MIddle High School, Libby Public School

div.p: As you have likely heard, the Governor has extended the school closure until at least April 10, 2020. April 10th is Good Friday and is a scheduled day off. We will not be providing any services on that day.

During this time of “Shelter in Place”, we will still be providing learning opportunities and meals for homes. Libby Schools, like the rest of the country, are creating a new model as we move through this unprecedented time. Through the course of this time we will likely make adjustments as we find things that work and do not work.

If there is a bright spot in this period of time, it is how good people have rallied to support those that need the most. The children and young adults in Libby are one of the most resilient groups and I have no doubt that the challenges today will help them be better citizens tomorrow. With the support of ALL of us, we can ensure that happens.

In this unusual period of time, now more than ever, Libby Schools and parents need to team up to create a plan that will help our students continue to learn. It is important that we do what we can to avoid “gaps in learning”. We need to ensure to the best of our ability that our 3rd graders are ready for 4th grade, and our 9th grade English students can be successful in 10th grade English, etc.

Our teachers will be checking in to answer any questions or concerns you may have. If at any time you or your child/children feel overwhelmed by our extended packets reach out to your child’s/children’s teachers and they can help. As parents themselves many teachers are experiencing the same anxieties and challenges. You will find their insight valuable and may help ease some of your stress.

Extended Learning Packets can be picked up Wednesday through Friday. The schools will provide specific times. We are hoping that by extending these days we will not have a flood of people coming in to pick up or deliver work. If you are a bus student and would like work delivered we will do that on Wednesdays. You need to contact your school and tell them your child’s name and bus number.

Meals will be delivered on routes similar to last week. It will be 4 hours later than the normal bus pick up time. At Libby Elementary, Libby Middle/High School, and Central Schools Grab-n-Go meals will be available from 11:15 to 12:30.
Our hope is to get our students back in our schools even if it is only for a few weeks. We look forward to working face-to-face again with the students in our buildings.
